text: Intelsat III F-6 was a communications satellite owned by Intelsat. The satellite had an estimated useful life of 5 years. == Design == The first of eight Intelsat III satellites to be launched, Intelsat III F-6 was built by TRW. It was a spacecraft equipped with two transponders to be powered by body- mounted solar cells generating 183 watts of power. It had a design life of five years and carried an SVM-2 apogee motor for propulsion. == Launch == Intelsat III F-6 was launched on the maiden flight of the Delta M rocket, flying from Launch Complex 17A at the Cape Canaveral Air Force Station. The launch took place on January 15, 1970, with the spacecraft bound for a geosynchronous transfer orbit. ==See also== * 1970 in spaceflight ==References== Category:Intelsat satellites Category:Spacecraft launched in 1970 Category:1970 in spaceflight Category:Satellite launch failures
title: Intelsat III F-6
